games.chess

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • joueur.BaseGameObject
      • games.chess.GameObject
        • games.chess.Player

  • public class Player
extends GameObject
    A player in this game. Every AI controls one player.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.lang.String clientType
      What type of client this is, e.g.
      java.lang.String color
      The color (side) of this player.
      boolean inCheck
      True if this player is currently in check, and must move out of check, false otherwise.
      boolean lost
      If the player lost the game or not.
      boolean madeMove
      If the Player has made their move for the turn.
      java.lang.String name
      The name of the player.
      Player opponent
      This player's opponent in the game.
      java.util.List<Piece> pieces
      All the uncaptured chess Pieces owned by this player.
      int rankDirection
      The direction your Pieces must go along the rank axis until they reach the other side.
      java.lang.String reasonLost
      The reason why the player lost the game.
      java.lang.String reasonWon
      The reason why the player won the game.
      double timeRemaining
      The amount of time (in ns) remaining for this AI to send commands.
      boolean won
      If the player won the game or not.

    • Field Detail

      • clientType

        public java.lang.String clientType
        What type of client this is, e.g. 'Python', 'JavaScript', or some other language. For potential data mining purposes.

      • color

        public java.lang.String color
        The color (side) of this player. Either 'White' or 'Black', with the 'White' player having the first move.

      • inCheck

        public boolean inCheck
        True if this player is currently in check, and must move out of check, false otherwise.

      • lost

        public boolean lost
        If the player lost the game or not.

      • madeMove

        public boolean madeMove
        If the Player has made their move for the turn. true means they can no longer move a Piece this turn.

      • name

        public java.lang.String name
        The name of the player.

      • opponent

        public Player opponent
        This player's opponent in the game.

      • pieces

        public java.util.List<Piece> pieces
        All the uncaptured chess Pieces owned by this player.

      • rankDirection

        public int rankDirection
        The direction your Pieces must go along the rank axis until they reach the other side.

      • reasonLost

        public java.lang.String reasonLost
        The reason why the player lost the game.

      • reasonWon

        public java.lang.String reasonWon
        The reason why the player won the game.

      • timeRemaining

        public double timeRemaining
        The amount of time (in ns) remaining for this AI to send commands.

      • won

        public boolean won
        If the player won the game or not.
